reviews.review: If you enjoyed playing Portal, then Portal 2 is a must have.  The single player campaign is great, and co-op is a very nice addition.  Designing your own levels can be confusing at first, but can also be fun.
Sehr gutes Spiel & genialer Humor :-)

Tolles Spiel, Toll gemacht, Geile Handlung, Kniflige Fallen und viele ROFL momente.

Das ist Portal 2.. Single- und Multiplayer haben mich sehr Überzeugt und kann somit jedem das Spiel nur Empfehlen. Und wenn ihr es euch schon Kauft, dann am besten gleich noch mit einem Freund.

10/10 Punkte + 2 Bonuspunkte für Super Lustig
loved portal 2, longer than 1st portal game. fun workin out how to get out of situations using the portal gun and other available items.

Best game of 2011, hands down.
GLaDOS steals the show once again, yet there is some competition to be found from the rest of the cast.
Also!... Possibly the greatest ending in VG history!

All of the old tricks, a bunch of new tricks, and even more GlaDOS than ever before - what's there not to love? This time, the trusty portal gun will be not only your weapon in a battle of wits against cybernetic malevolence, but also an instrument of story-telling and a tool of exploration as the game throws you out of the septic confinement of test chambers and into cyclopean environments that guard the history of Aperture Labs. Some of the locations have an almost "open world" feeling about them and the puzzles will often turn into a challenge of "Find Waldo" involving portal-able surfaces, and many of them could be described as "cheap" in retrospect. Yet the story and the consistently amazing character writing are enough to keep you going even through the most frustrating of trials.

Finally a game which provides Action, Puzzle Mastery and Beating the Clock. The single player campaign gives you days worth of problems following a great storyline and awesome characters. The further you get in the campaign the harder the puzzles, making you scream with frustration and result in: drawing routes down, scout the area for other advantages, and in the end watch a god play it online and copy. 

The Mutiplayer co-op game type is also just as incredbile! with not as long as campaign but just as hard puzzles. With your friend, you laugh at your failures, enjoy the high fives and jumps through the air, and connect with your character. 

If you had enough of both campaigns, well then try your own workshop, by making your own puzzle to match the saints who make the campaign. Once you have made your own, load it up on a gaming site so everyone else - your friends, family and dog can play it too. A great game and worth at least $30!

Portal 2 is an amazing sequal next to the first groundbraking game of the Portal series. Portal 2 will keep you busy for hours on in with the endless amount of levels which constantly test one's skills of deduction and problem solving. The campaign mode fun but yet daunting sets you in a futuristic maze of technology. If that doesn't entertain you the constant back and forth commentary between everyone's favorite AI GLaDOS and of course Wheatley will give you a good laugh or two. Portal 2 also now offers a Co-Op mode which lets multiple players engage in solving the most difficult levels while having a buddy at your side. The game also has a lot of extra mods and user created levels off of the Steam Workshop for all of you willing to constantly test new levels. On top of Portal 2 being an amazing sequel to the series, it's a fairly inexpensive game for the amount of content you get out of the game. Portal 2 is just one of those games you can pick up at anytime, fun for everyone.

A VAST improvement on the first, and notably longer. It's a much more plot-driven game this time around and adds a lot of flavor to the game, but it doesn't focus so much on the story so as to distract from the main gameplay. It's the PERFECT balance between story and gameplay for a game of its kind. New gameplay mechanics (i.e. gels and lasers) make for a myriad of new puzzles and head-scratching moments to be had, community levels make for an almost endless array of levels and fun, and co-op is a great way to spend time with your friends and solve puzzles together...
...or let them do all the work while you sit around dunking them in acid as they cross a hard light bridge under your control. 
BUT ALL IN ALL, this game is nothing short of amazing, and I honestly think it's one of those must-have games.
